elements.content:
People react differently to certain types of thoughts.
Please indicate how much each of the following statements corresponds to your way of reacting to certain thoughts.

elements.text: There are things I prefer not to think about.
I avoid situations that make me pay attention to things I don't want to think about.
I replace threatening mental images with internal dialogue.
I think about things that concern me as if they were happening to someone else.
I have thoughts that I try to avoid.
I try not to think about the most disturbing aspects of certain situations to avoid being too afraid.
I sometimes avoid objects that can trigger disturbing thoughts.
I distract myself to avoid thinking about certain troubling subjects.
I avoid people who make me think about things I don't want to think about.
I often do things to distract myself from my thoughts.
I think about useless details to avoid thinking about important subjects that worry me.
Sometimes I immerse myself in an activity to avoid thinking about certain things.
To avoid thinking about subjects that bother me, I force myself to think about something else.
There are things I try not to think about.
I maintain an internal dialogue to avoid seeing scenarios (a sequence of images) that frighten me.
Sometimes I avoid places that make me think about things I would prefer not to think about.
I think about past events to avoid thinking about insecure future events.
I avoid taking actions that remind me of things I don't want to think about.
